uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.content

Class TextContentBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.content.TextContentBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContentBuilder, ExtendedXMLBuilder, SimpleXMLBuilder

    public class TextContentBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements ContentBuilder, ExtendedXMLBuilder
    A ContentBuilder that generates plain text.
    Author:
    spb

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        public ExtendedXMLBuilder getText()
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        create a ExtendedXMLBuilder that appends its contents as XML text when the SimpleXMLBuilder.appendParent() method is called. Normally this represents a separate paragraph of text but this can be mapped onto ContentBuilder.getSpan() where this does not make sense for example where the ContentBuilder represents a heading or table cell.
        Specified by:
        getText in interface ContentBuilder
        Returns:
        ExtendedXMLBuilder

      • getSpan

        public ExtendedXMLBuilder getSpan()
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        create a ExtendedXMLBuilder that appends its contents as XML text when the SimpleXMLBuilder.appendParent() method is called. This is intended for in-line text rather than creating a paragraph.
        Specified by:
        getSpan in interface ContentBuilder
        Returns:
        ExtendedXMLBuilder

      • addText

        public void addText(java.lang.String text)
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        Add unformatted text. Equivalent to ContentBuilder.getText().clean(text).appendParent().
        Specified by:
        addText in interface ContentBuilder
        Parameters:
        text - string to add to content

      • cleanFormatted

        public boolean cleanFormatted(int max,
                     java.lang.String s)
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        add a pre-formatted string as a text section. In HTML this is either as a pre-formated section or a paragraph containing a series of explicitly broken lines (if any of the lines are longer than the specified threshold.
        Specified by:
        cleanFormatted in interface ContentBuilder
        Parameters:
        max - max line length
        Returns:
        true if lines are long

      • getHeading

        public ContentBuilder getHeading(int level)
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        create a ContentBuilder that appends its contents as a heading when the ContentBuilder.addParent() method is called. If the heading is to only contain text use the ContentBuilder.addHeading(int, String) method.
        Specified by:
        getHeading in interface ContentBuilder
        Parameters:
        level - level of heading
        Returns:
        ContentBuilder for header

      • addHeading

        public void addHeading(int level,
              java.lang.String text)
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        Convenience routine to add a heading containing unformatted text. This is equivalent to ContentBuilder.getHeading(int).addText(text).
        Specified by:

      • addFormInput

        public <I,T> void addFormInput(AppContext conn,
                      Field<I> f,
                      T item)
        Description copied from interface: ContentBuilder
        Add the input for a form Field If the input is a RadioButtonInput then the item parameter selects which item the input is for. If item is null then a RadioButtonInput will output all inputs in a block.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        conn - AppContext
        f - Field
        item - item (only used by RadioInputs)

      • getNested

        public SimpleXMLBuilder getNested()
                           throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: SimpleXMLBuilder
        Get a new SimpleXMLBuilder of the same type as this object. This is to build un-commited content that is appended to this object using the SimpleXMLBuilder.appendParent() method. The calling code need only hold a reference to the current builder as the SimpleXMLBuilder.appendParent() method returns the parent.
        Specified by:
        getNested in interface SimpleXMLBuilder
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns:
        SimpleXMLBuilder

      • setEscapeUnicode

        public boolean setEscapeUnicode(boolean escape_unicode)
        Description copied from interface: SimpleXMLBuilder
        Should high code-point unicode characters be escaped to avoid charset problems. This is advisory only the implementation is free to ignore this call and return false in all cases.
        Specified by:
        setEscapeUnicode in interface SimpleXMLBuilder
        Returns:
        previous setting.
